meanings.definition: The fact or process of ending or being brought to an end.
meanings.sent1: The cessation of the rain brought out the sun.
meanings.sent2: The teacher called for the cessation of noise in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The sudden cessation of the music startled the party guests.
meanings.sent4: The cessation of laughter marked the end of the comedian's performance.
meanings.sent5: The cessation of the train whistle signaled the departure of the locomotive.

meanings.definition: A temporary or complete stopping; discontinuance.
meanings.sent1: The doctor advised a cessation of smoking for better health.
meanings.sent2: The cessation of construction caused traffic delays.
meanings.sent3: The sudden cessation of the clock's ticking made the room eerily quiet.
meanings.sent4: The cessation of the fountain's flow left the garden in stillness.
meanings.sent5: The cessation of the wind brought a calmness to the stormy sea.
